summary: The document is a military record that details the investigation into Robert Scheer's associations with various leftist and communist groups during the 1960s, leading to a recommendation against his service in any military capacity. It highlights his refusal to complete specific military forms in 1966 and lists his affiliations with groups such as the Vietnam Day Committee, Communist Party, Socialist Workers Party, and others. Originally classified, the document was later regraded to unclassified on September 19, 1994, and released with certain deletions.
key_findings: Robert Scheer was recommended for rejection from military service due to his active membership and leadership in radical leftist groups.

The document lists Scheer's associations with the Vietnam Day Committee, Communist Party, Socialist Workers Party, Progressive Labor Party, and the Berkeley Chapter of the W.E.B. DuBois Clubs of America.
Scheer refused to complete the Armed Forces Security Questionnaire and the Statement of Personal History in 1966.
The document was originally classified but was regraded to unclassified on September 19, 1994, and released with deletions.
